abstract: A transfer representation for types that transfer as a file URL.
overview:
## Overview

Use a [doc://com.apple.CoreTransferable/documentation/CoreTransferable/FileRepresentation] for transferring types that involve a large amount of data. For example, if your app defines a `Movie` type that could represent a lengthy video, use a `FileRepresentation` instance to transfer the video data to another app or process.

Note that the overall recommendation is to specify the content type that describes the file content as close as possible. For example, if you are sharing a PDF file, declare a [doc://com.apple.CoreTransferable/documentation/CoreTransferable/FileRepresentation] of a `UTType.pdf` content type, instead of `UTType.fileURL` or `UTType.content` so the data can be dragged, shared, or imported to apps that support that data type:

It’s efficient to pass data around as a file and the receiver loads it into memory only if it’s required.

items.description: Creates a transfer representation for importing and exporting transferable items as files.
